intro: Freycinetia luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in catkin-like inflorescences. Freycinetia luzonensis is adapted to coastal and wetland environments, showcasing its resilience to saline and waterlogged conditions.
